table: Data Train Dev Test STEPS -CLS 2.68M 1K 1K STEPS -MC 298K 1K 1K
references: The benchmark of sequence order reasoning is conducted based on the           Food.com Recipes          dataset, a web crawled dataset of recipes from ‚Äúfood.com‚Äú over 18 years which is collected and released by           Majumder et¬†al. (             2019            )          . We keep the original train/dev/test splits for recipes and filter the recipes with less than four action steps or more than ten action steps to avoid exceeding input context length limitation of LLMs. id_table_2.caption: Model architecture details of baseline LLMs evaluated on the proposed benchmark. We present the number of parameters (#Params), the number of layers (#L), Embedding Dimension (Embd), the number of heads (#H), and the training batch size in tokens (Bsz).
table: Models #Params #L Embd #H Bsz GPT2-Small 117M 12 768 12 0.5M GPT2-Medium 345M 24 1024 16 0.5M GPT2-Large 774M 36 1280 20 0.5M GPT2-XL 1.5B 48 1600 25 0.5M OPT-1.3B 1.3B 24 2048 32 1M OPT-13B 13B 40 5120 40 1M OPT-30B 30B 48 7168 56 4M BLOOM-3B 3B 30 2560 32 1M BLOOM-7B1 7.1B 30 4096 32 1M
references: For the baselines of proposed           STEPS          benchmark, we evaluate three groups of significant large language models, including 1) four size of GPT-2           Radford et¬†al. (             2019            )          (Small, Medium, Large, and XL); 2) three size of Open-Pretrained-Transformer Language Models (OPT)           Zhang et¬†al. (             2022            )          (1.3B, 13B, and 30B); 3) two size of BigScience Large Open-science Open-access Multilingual Language Model (BLOOM)           Scao et¬†al. (             2022            )          (3B, 7B1). We include the model architecture details for all baseline LLMs in Table                  2                .

id_table_3.caption: The results of baseline large language models on the proposedbenchmark. We report accuracy as the evaluation metric. For the results on few-shot in-context learning, we adopt six random seeds to select the demonstration examples. We report the mean of the accuracy on six random seeds and attach the standard deviation as the subscript.
table: Model (#Params ‚Üë ‚Üë \uparrow ) Multi-Choice Accuracy ‚Üë ‚Üë \uparrow Majority Class 50 GPT2-Small 59.3 GPT2-Medium 63.5 GPT2-Large 65.1 OPT-1.3B 66.0 GPT2-XL 65.4 BLOOM-3B 68.4 BLOOM-7b1 69.8 OPT-13B 71.3 OPT-30B 71.7
references: The evaluation results of baseline LLMs on the proposed two subtasks of           STEPS          benchmark are presented in Table                  3                and Table                  4                .

id_table_4.caption: Experimental results of baseline LLMs on classification subtask of the proposedbenchmark. We report the classification Sen. (Sensitivity), Spec. (Specificity), and G-Mean (Geometric Mean of Sensitivity and Specificity) of each baseline LLM, in which Sensitivity and Specificity are the class-wise accuracy on positive and negative sets respectively. For the results on few-shot in-context learning, we adopt six random seeds to select the demonstration examples. We report the mean of the metric on six random seeds and attach the standard deviation as the subscript.
